quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Henry Viii and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, bobs. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What actor was nominated for an Academy Award for his portrayal of Facebook creator Mark Zuckerberg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jesse Eisenberg

questions.question: What was Anne Boleyn, Henry VIIIs second wife, accused of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adultery, incest and high treason

questions.question: In 1536, Henry VIIIs two daughters, Mary and Elizabeth, were declared illegitimate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When did Henry VIIIs reign as King of England end?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 28 January 1547

questions.question: Henry VIII desperately desired to have a son and Anne Boleyn was able to fulfill his dream.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How many of Henry VIIIs wives were called Catherine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three

questions.question: Who was the first man to climb Mount Everest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edmund Hillary

questions.question: Which of the following Bobs had a famous song called Blowin in the Wind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Dylan

questions.question: How many times did Henry VIII of England marry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: six

questions.question: Henry VIII enjoyed good health before his death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of Henry VIIIs wives gave birth to his son, Prince Edward?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane Seymour

questions.question: Henry VIII was known as a “Renaissance Man”.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Henry VIII called for public displays of joy upon the death of his ex-wife Catherine of Aragon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What American actor, director and producer of Italian and black ancestry was born Mark Sinclair Vincent in 1967?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vin Diesel

questions.question: Who was the first man to run the mile in less than 4 minutes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Bannister

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: England and Statement
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: She was one of the wealthiest and most powerful women of feudal Europe. At the age of 15 she married Louis VII, King of France and her second husband was King Henry II of England.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eleanor of Aquitaine

questions.question: What American actor became famous as a member of the 1990s hip-hop band Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Wahlberg

questions.question: What British rock band did Mark Knopfler co-found with his brother David in 1977?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dire Straits

questions.question: It is generally believed that Mark Anthony and his lover Cleopatra committed suicide after being defeated by this emperor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Octavian (Augustus)

questions.question: Who portrayed Luke Skywalker in George Lucas original Star Wars trilogy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Hamill

questions.question: What celebrity was murdered by Mark David Chapman on 8 December, 1980 in New York City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lennon

questions.question: This Spanish lady came to England in 1371 as part of the retinue accompanying Doña Constanza.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sancha de Ayala

questions.question: What romantic comedy movie, starring Julia Roberts and Richard Gere, featured Marc Anthonys song You Sang to Me?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Runaway Bride

questions.question: What statement is not true about Samuel Langhorne Clemens, better known by his pen name Mark Twain?

options.text: He died during a visit of the Halleys Comet.
He was born during a visit of the Halleys Comet.
He possessed financial acumen and made successful investments in various inventions.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He possessed financial acumen and made successful investments in various inventions.

questions.question: Which lady ruled England for nine days?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane Grey

questions.question: According to legend, this Anglo-Saxon noblewoman of the 11th century rode naked through the streets of Coventry, England.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Godiva

questions.question: Saint Margaret, Queen of Scotland was canonized by Pope Innocent IV and was declared the patroness and protectress of Scotland.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which statement is not true about Marcus Aurelius, who ruled the Roman Empire from 161 to 180?

options.text: He was adopted by Roman Emperor Antonius Pious and succeeded him in 161.
He was killed by his son Commodus.
He was a prominent Stoic philosopher.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was killed by his son Commodus.

questions.question: Name Henry VIIIs daughter by his second wife, Anne Boleyn.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth I

questions.question: Isabella of Mar died before her husband Robert the Bruce was crowned King of Scots, and never became Queen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Vegetarianism and Vegetarian
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leader, ambitions. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Irish playwright became a vegetarian at the age of  twenty-five, after hearing a lecture by H. F. Lester.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Bernard Shaw

questions.question: This Italian artist, who painted The Virgin of the Rocks, was one of the first supporters of vegetarianism when it reappeared as a philosophy during the Renaissance.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonardo da Vinci

questions.question: This American photographer wrote several cookbooks and introduced a line of frozen vegetarian meals in 1991.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Linda McCartney

questions.question: This Spanish architect, whose best works include Casa Milà and Casa Batllóollowed in Barcelona, was a strict vegetarian from an early age because of his rheumatism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antonio Gaudi

questions.question: What political leader do these words of wisdom belong to: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winston Churchill

questions.question: This Flying Finn was a vegetarian since he was 12 years old.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paavo Nurmi

questions.question: This virtuoso violinist and conductor, born in New York to Belorussian Jewish parents, became vegetarian after his encounter with yoga, Indian culture and Indian sitar player Ravi Shankar.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yehudi Menuhin

questions.question: What famous American is quoted here: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Twain

questions.question: This Indian peace activist, who was assassinated in 1948, wrote the book The Moral Basis of Vegetarianism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mahatma Gandhi

questions.question: This Russian writer was the author of The Death of Ivan Ilyich, War and Peace as well as of several essays on vegetarianism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leo Tolstoy

questions.question: Which of Henry VIIIs daughters became known as “Bloody Mary”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Tudor

questions.question: Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Anna of Cleves, Katherine Howard and Elizabeth of York were all married to Henry VIII.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: As long as men massacre animals, they will kill each other. Indeed, he who sows the seeds of murder and pain cannot reap the joy of love. is a quote by this ancient Greek mystic and mathematician.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pythagoras

questions.question: This English romantic poet wrote several essays on vegetarianism, including A Vindication of Natural Diet and On the Vegetable System of Diet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Percy Bysshe Shelley

questions.question: Which of the following books focuses on the life of Elizabeth of York?

options.text: The Dragon and the Rose by Roberta Gellis
The Tudor Rose by Margaret Campbell Barnes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: History Quiz: George Washington and George Washingtons
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, ronald. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What influential author and poet, known for his biting wit, stated The old believe everything, the middle-aged suspect everything, the young know everything.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oscar Wilde

questions.question: What was the first name of George Washingtons father?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Augustine

questions.question: Ronald Reagan grew up in a middle-class family in Tampico, Illinois, his father being a successful 3 term state representative.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What was George Washingtons natural non-powdered hair color in his early days?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red

questions.question: The famous story of the hatchet and the chopped cherry tree, when young George Washington claimed I cannot tell a lie, is mostly based on historical fact.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This famous artist and co-founder of the Cubist movement said, Give me a museum and Ill fill it.”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pablo Picasso

questions.question: Who wrote in one of his most popular works, There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Shakespeare

questions.question: What famous physicist said, Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and Im not sure about the former.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Einstein

questions.question: What famous playwright, born in Dublin, stated, If there is nothing wrong with the world, there wouldnt be anything for us to do.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Bernard Shaw

questions.question: George Washington went abroad once in his life. Where did he go?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barbados

questions.question: George Washingtons prescient heroic future started with two victories against the French in 1754 at Ft. Duquesne and then at the Monogohela under General Braddock.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: George Washington was born outside of Boston in the Massachusetts Bay Colony in 1732.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What psychologist and philosopher is quoted here: I dont sing because Im happy, Im happy because I sing.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William James

questions.question: What popular fictional character said, Do, or do not. There is no try.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yoda

questions.question: What famous lady made this statement: A woman is like a teabag, you cant tell how strong she is until you put her in hot water.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nancy Reagan

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Malcolm X and Malcolm
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, poe. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1943 Malcolm X joined the Army.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Ronald Reagans family and closest friends knew him by this affectionate nickname.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dutch

questions.question: What was the name of the German youth who, in the 1820s, claimed to have grown up in the total isolation of a darkened cell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kaspar Hauser

questions.question: He was a Jewish teacher, dressed like a vagabond, who taught a small number of distinguished students in post-World War II Europe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monsieur Chouchani

questions.question: A mosque is a Christian term synonymous with the word church.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What statement is true about the mysterious person nicknamed Poe Toaster?

options.text: He would leave three roses and a partially-filled bottle of French cognac on Edgar Allen Poes grave.
He claimed he was Edgar Allen Poes son.
He claimed he was Edgar Allen Poes ghost.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He would leave three roses and a partially-filled bottle of French cognac on Edgar Allen Poes grave.

questions.question: Ronald Reagans political career was launched in 1964 when he gave a live TV speech entitled A Time For Choosing in support of which Presidential Candidate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barry Goldwater

questions.question: Malcolm X went to prison for committing which of the following crimes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: breaking  entering, larceny, carrying firearms

questions.question: In what year did Malcolm Xs wife give birth to their last two children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1965

questions.question: Malcolm X left the Nation of Islam (NOI) because he found out Elijah Muhammad was laundering money.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Where was Ronald Reagan standing when he spoke these words in 1976: And then again there is that challenge of which he spoke that we live in a world in which the great powers have poised and aimed at each other horrible missiles of destruction, nuclear weapons that can in a matter of minutes arrive at each others country and destroy, virtually, the civilized world we live in.?

options.text: On the Platform of the main stage at the Republican Convention.
On the stairs of Independence Hall in Philadelphia.
At the base of the Statue of Liberty.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On the Platform of the main stage at the Republican Convention.

questions.question: Ronald Reagan had many early careers. One of his first was as a Sportscaster for WHO Radio in Des Moines, Iowa. What future president did he watch play in an Iowa - Michigan football game that he called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gerald Ford

questions.question: Babushka Lady is the nickname of a mysterious woman who might have photographed the events surrounding the assassination of John F. Kennedy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1953 Malcolm X went to what city to study to become a minister?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago

questions.question: Which of the following sayings is attributed to Malcolm X?

options.text: There shall be no solution to this race problem until you, yourselves, strike the blow for liberty.
You can kill a man but you cant kill an idea.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By any means necessary

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Words and Life
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, leader, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Complete this saying by a Persian Sufi leader: It is with a word as with a/an __________: once let it loose, and it does not return.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: arrow

questions.question: Spanish soldier Gil Perez claimed that he suddenly appeared in Mexico City on October 26, 1593 while he was on sentry duty in Manila.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who do these words belong to: Fishes live in the sea, as men do a-land; the great ones eat up the little ones.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Shakespeare

questions.question: What famous American does this quote belong to: Dream as if youll live forever. Live as if youll die today.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Dean

questions.question: The Man in the Iron Mask, who died in 1703, was a prisoner during the reign of King Louis XIV of France.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who does this quote belong to: Part of the secret of success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Twain

questions.question: What is the origin of the proverb, He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is a Chinese proverb.

questions.question: What statement is true about the Green Children of Woolpit?

options.text: They spoke in an unrecognized language.
They reportedly appeared in the village of Woolpit in Suffolk, UK, in the 12th century.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of the following was popular as “The Wonderman”?

options.text: The Man in the Iron Mask

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Comte St Germain

questions.question: Who made this statement: He who has a thousand friends has not a friend to spare. And he who has one enemy will meet him everywhere.?

options.text: Ali, The Fourth Caliph of Islam

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ali, The Fourth Caliph of Islam

questions.question: D. B. Cooper is the name used to refer to a notorious bank robber.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these paintings was not created by Leonardo Da Vinci?

options.text: The Virgin and Child with St. Anne

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Creation of Adam

questions.question: Who do these words belong to: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. The greatest thing in life is to keep your mind young.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Ford

questions.question: Fulcanelli is a pseudonym assumed by an American alchemist and author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who made the following remark about books: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed and few to be chewed and digested.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francis Bacon
